snippet.title: Light Therapy for Seasonal Affective Disorder and Depression
snippet.description: What is light therapy?Light therapy (phototherapy) is exposure to light that is brighter than indoor light but not as bright as direct sunlight. Do not use ultraviolet light, full - spectrum light, heat lamps, or tanning lamps for light therapy.Light therapy may help with depression ...

snippet.title: Light Therapy Products - Seasonal Affective Disorder
snippet.description: We started with Light therapy for Winter blues or SAD. Do you experience seasonal depression or the winter blues? Do you experience lower energy levels, weight gain, fatigue, interrupted sleep and irritability each fall and winter?

snippet.title: Light Therapy for depression - PsychEducation.org
snippet.description: Why? How much light are you getting? Light therapy can treat more than just winter depression, though that's the main use. Here's why: the amount of light reaching your eyeball from interior lighting is far less than the amount from the real thing.
